884785657:
[

Rostering Specialist

Company Name Coles Company Location Hawthorn East, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

The role

Reporting to the Outbound Planning and Rosters Manager, an exciting 24 month fixed term career prospect exists for a passionate individual to support the continuous improvement of roster management. You will create optimal seasonal event store delivery rosters and manage ad-hoc store delivery roster change requests to provide accuracy and timely availability of roster data in all systems.

To be successful, you’ll have
  • demonstrated Supply Chain Operations experience with exposure to rostering
  • proven track record of delivering results
  • strong problem solving skills with the ability to create case studies to establish root cause and impact and develop solutions to address these issues
  • strong stakeholder, time management and excellent communication skills
  • exceptional customer and team focus
  • advanced Excel skills and high attention to detail


Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To
  • effectively negotiate across various stakeholder groups in managing roster changes
  • provide a strategic review of rosters across network to optimise cost and service working across Stores, Transport, and Distribution Centre’s
  • communicate roster changes to impacted logistics and store teams
  • accurately input roster data

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.

As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

Benefits

If that isn’t exciting enough, as a team member at Coles you
  • will receive a staff discount and exclusive team member offers
  • can enjoy a convenience store located onsite
  • are able to sample new products and flavours before they hit the shelves
  • have access to a Fitness Centre and Body Therapy Clinic
  • will be part of a fun and inclusive culture where customer, community and team are at the heart of what we do


About Us

Today, Coles is one of Australia’s iconic retailers, providing a range of fresh food, groceries, general merchandise, liquor and fuel to millions of customers every week.

We have a combination of over 2,400 retail outlets across Australia covering Coles supermarkets, Coles Express fuel and convenience sites, Spirit Hotels and liquor stores under Liquorland, Vintage Cellars and First Choice Liquor branding.

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same – our customer first strategy. We have over 112,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please Note

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply.

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

This role is eligible for the Team Member Referral Program

Industry

  • Retail

Employment Type

Other

886485080:
[

Senior Code Compliance Analyst - Life Insurance

Company Name Australian Financial Complaints Authority Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

\xa0

The Code Compliance and Monitoring team serves Australian consumers by supporting financial service providers to continually improve their services. Working on behalf of independent committees, we monitor code compliance, investigate alleged code breaches and share examples of good industry practice.

\xa0

We currently have a full-time, fixed-term vacancy until 30 September 2020 for a Senior Code Compliance Analyst to work within our Code Compliance and Monitoring Team, focusing on Life Insurance Code matters.

\xa0

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the Code Compliance Monitoring Committees and Code Compliance Manager by providing high quality compliance analysis and investigation of serious and systemic Code breach allegations. You will conduct research, draft correspondence and prepare reports as required for the Committee and take a lead role on a number of projects.

\xa0

You will also assist in the implementation of the compliance program for the Life Insurance Code of Practice. This is a significant time of change in the financial services industry and this role will assist in the development and delivery of that change by influencing culture within the industry.

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you will have considerable experience within the life insurance industry and have a strong technical background.

Ideally, you will be degree-qualified in a related discipline such as financial services, compliance, data analytics or law. You will have excellent written and oral communication skills and be able to demonstrate your strong ability to research, analyse and draw conclusions from data.

\xa0

In return, we offer you a competitive remuneration package, inclusive of salary packaging options. You will work within a close knit and supportive team, with career development opportunities and a positive work/ life balance. Extensive health and wellbeing initiatives are available including an onsite employee assistance program and fun social events.

\xa0

To apply for this role, please submit your CV and covering letter. Applications close 3 October 2018.

\xa0

For more information about this role please visit www.afca.org.au/careers, or email grinaldo@fos.org.au

\xa0

\xa0 \xa0

\xa0

Sales Marketing Manager

Company Name SearchWorks Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our client is a global manufacturer of high-end and designer decorative surfaces used as benchtops, flooring systems, cladding and paving systems used in design led construction products. They are well financed and have enjoyed rapid growth in the last 18 months in their Victorian operation through the strategic acquisition of market share from their competition.

Their products are typically made-to-order and can be found in designer housing, commercial buildings such as Airports or in premium landscaping projects. They are now looking to recruit a sales person to manage a portfolio of accounts in Victoria. They are able to offer full training on both their products and market sector and as such look to recruit highly skilled B2B solution based sales professionals to bring fresh eyes to their industry.

\xa0

The Role:

You will be based from Melbourne and the focus of your customer base is in the metro area, however you will be required to travel interstate infrequently in order to meet your customer’s requirements. The role is varied in the sense that you will be focused on both horizontal and vertical relationship building with the Architects, tier 1 - 4 commercial and residential builders and associated subcontractors.

They have a strong brand in the market and enjoy a large and ever increasing market share, as such this is a key role and requires an applicant with a good understanding of strategic account management and relationship building.

\xa0

The Candidate:

What you have sold is of less importance than how you sell it, you will be able to demonstrate tangible success in previous roles and you will be looking to step in to a market leading organisation that will offer you a genuine career path.

Ideally, you will have already received formal sales training (Miller Heiman/SPIN/Challenger etc) and/or a University degree. You will be a seasoned professional and will be well regarded within your current industry. Through their digital download solution, BorrowBox - your library in one app - Bolinda is the leading digital library provider in the world. BorrowBox, which enables members of public libraries, schools and universities to download and borrow eContent, is the fastest growing digital library platform in Australia and the UK. Bolinda has offices in Melbourne, the UK and NZ, doing business globally to provide great opportunities for exceptional people.


Bolinda believe that to enjoy the success that only the 1% have, you have to do what only the 1% do. They pride themselves on their innovative, cutting edge approach to business and follow Franklin Covey's 4 Disciplines of Execution\xa0and Robin Sharma's Lead Without a Title\xa0principles.


You will work in stylish, contemporary offices and in an organisation always pushing boundaries and forging new paths and opportunities.


About the Opportunity

Our Founder and Publisher requires the Personal and Executive Administration support of an Executive Assistant to ensure she can focus on delivering the single most important goals of the company.


You will work closely with our Founder daily to help deliver the most enjoyable and productive work environments and experiences for our Founder and her teams and your assistance means her days, weeks and months are prepared, focused and organised at all levels to deliver the major goals and rocks of the business.


Your tasks will include:

  • Extensive diary management
  • Organizing domestic and international travel and appointments
  • Attend meetings, prepare and distribute agendas and take minutes
  • Project manage and keep the team accountable for deliverables
  • Assist with delivery of brand creative and prepare communications to internal and external stakeholders
  • Be an advocate for Bolinda values and assist with creating and fostering Bolinda’s team culture
  • Maintain a beautiful office environment
  • Assist with personal diary and tasks as required


Don’t be fooled by the title, this role will require you to be a right hand to the Founder, so any experience in publishing or marketing in larger organizations or experience shadowing a CEO will be highly advantageous. This is a unique opportunity to work side by side as a peer with the Founder.


About You

Ideally you will have a keen interest in the business of Publishing – rights and contracts, love books and working with books, enjoy being a part of and contributing to marketing initiatives and campaigns, product development and communications across the globally successful audiobook publishing and technology business.


You must possess superior writing skills (writing press releases, linked in posts), love books, have a good eye for composition, have a high interest in the publishing/media industry. Experience in the publishing industry will be distinct advantage.


You will be confident yet down to earth, have a can do positive attitude and strong work ethic, possess excellent organization skills and strong communication skills, be a super organizer, be highly skilled technically, love administration, setting things up learning new things and enjoy being a right hand. You will work in a highly supportive entrepreneurial environment that is well-known for its even pace and making the impossible possible across global markets (Bolinda has an office located in Newbury, UK).


Bolinda is world renowned for its high standards and quality, and for outputting some of the best products and services in its industry – publishing and media – all of which you will be hands on in contributing to.


To succeed at Bolinda you will need to show initiative, professionalism, discipline, and the right attitude. Excellent interpersonal skills and an uncompromised customer service focus will come naturally to you. At Bolinda we are looking for people who are eager to learn and to get involved, and for whom the words "nothing is impossible" are exciting rather than daunting.


Bolinda strongly believe in prioritizing the personal and professional development of their employees and you will have access to ongoing training and development, with significant room for advancement and growth within the organisation.


Don't miss this exciting opportunity to join this market leading firm and set the tone for your future success.


To apply please send your CV along with a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role to careers@bolinda.com\xa0

Applications without a covering letter will not be considered.

Merchandise Assistant – Dandenong South VIC

If successful in securing the position of Merchandise Assistant with Baby Bunting, you will be joining a high performing retail brand in Australia. With records of continued revenue growth over the last few years, this is a strong business to join. Reporting into the Retail Buyer this is a fantastic role for someone who is looking to build their experience and their career.


The Position Outline

To provide support to the planners and buyers to maximize department sales, gross profit and buying income with Baby Bunting. \xa0This role is instrumental in maintaining the product portfolio and database and working closely with the Buyer to support them to ensure data update processes and procedures are being followed.

  • Provide accurate and timely administrative support to the planner and buyer

Job description

The Knightery is on the lookout for a new Knight!

We are Australia's leading technology recruitment business and we work with some of most exciting brands in the country. We have teams built around the best recruiters in the market and we're voted one of Australia's coolest companies to work for (which is pretty darn awesome).

So what's the deal?

We're opening the doors to the Knightery for a new consultant; someone we can train from scratch. We don't do this often, most of our team is pretty experienced which means you'll have loads of people to learn from.

What do we need?

If you're business savvy, have experience in sales or have a real knack for dealing with people; this could be a game changer for your career.

Recruitment is about people; they are the heartbeat of business and we are right there in the middle of it all; changing lives, shaping and growing companies.

It's not always easy - but nothing worthwhile is. You'll need to be resilient but having our A-Team right there behind you makes a huge difference.

We'll train you; 1 on 1, at the desk, on the job.

We work with intent, with laser focus and commitment which means we achieve some pretty amazing things. We're a grown-up business that's young at heart, trust us - we know how to have fun!

You need to have 1 - 3 years in recruitment, it doesn't need to be IT, we can teach you that. But it's a 360 degree role, so you need to have business development experience.

What's in it for you?


  • Bespoke training and induction program with our very own L&D manager
  • Competitive base salary + industry leading commission plan
  • Flexible working - work from home, no fixed hours
  • HKmyday - A paid long weekend every month
  • Birthday leave

  • Latest tech and tools
  • 100 Club - Annual trip for hitting your placement target
  • Monthly/Quarterly Incentives - think afternoon lawn bowls, karaoke, picnics and bbqs
  • And you get to work with these guys: https://youtu.be/8PyPclQPKic

What now?

If you think you have what it takes, let us know! Apply however you like - we love video, pictures, stories - you know, the personal touch.

Associate Vet

Company Name Our Vet Company Location Mornington, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 1 hour ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Scenic location in Mornington – Victoria\xa0\xa0
  • Unique career - defining opportunity
  • Competitive salary and generous company benefits
  • Supportive culture that promotes work – life balance
  • Immediate start & Full/Part time available\xa0\xa0


At Our Vet.

Due to our continued growth and success, Our Vet Mornington is seeking to appoint 2 conscientious and ambitious Associate Vets to help support the increasing demands of this high performing clinic. The clinic’s achievements are attributed to the reputation and tireless work of our skilled Lead Vet and nursing team, who together provide the highest standard of care to pets entrusted to us every day. We also set ourselves apart from the “corporate” management of clinics and promote a personal approach with one another and our long - standing clients. Our relationships are forged on trust, integrity, diligence and a true family spirit. While there are several opportunities available to Associate Vets in the profession, this is a uniquely career – defining one. Here’s why.


Feel fulfilled with each day.

At Mornington, Our Lead Vet’s 18 years’ experience (spanning across country to GP small animal practice, emergency/critical care to shelter based work) enables the clinic to manage a diverse caseload from routine procedures to complex surgeries. Further to your current two or more years of experience, you will be guided by this seasoned mentor in the critical areas of consultations, diagnostics, standard procedures, surgeries and general preventative medicine of small animals and exotics. Our expanding resources will refine your application of modern clinical equipment used in imaging, microscopy, full surgeries (including isoflurane gas/anaesthesia), and dentals. Advocates for continuous education and personalised development we also offer a comprehensive 8 – week induction program and detailed clinical resources, an extensive library of certified online training modules on any subject of interest, invitations to industry events and conferences, and connecting you to a network of vets across our 27 clinics/stores nationwide. Should you be interested, we will extend your accountability and provide specific training to assist your career progression into leadership.


Based in the Best Friends, outside your clinic doors is one of the largest waiting rooms in Australia. You and your clients have immediate access to products, services and the knowledge of our retail and grooming teams ready to help you with information about nutrition, health & well - being range, the latest pet care products, pre - puppy school and animal behaviour, grooming and skin/coat care. This allows you to focus on your role as rely on the Best Friends team to support you the rest of the way. Each day you will feel a sense of fulfillment as you witness the difference you are making in the welfare of these pets and the impact on their devoted families, the clinical challenges you resolve and seeing yourself evolve as a vet who’s repeatedly asked for by name.


The benefits of Our Vet.

In support of a work – life balance, you will only be rostered ordinary or part time hours (if preferred), so no on-call or overtime are involved. Weekends are rotated across the veterinary team and sole charge days are rostered when you are ready. If all this wasn’t enough, you get to do this in one of the most scenic and enviable lifestyle locations. Your free time will ensure you get to enjoy the surrounding beaches, landscapes and activities that Mornington and Australia has to offer.


Mornington as your new home.

Have it all and apply now.\xa0

For further information about your new home, visit https://www.visitmorningtonpeninsula.org/.\xa0\xa0

Early Childhood Educator

Company Name Tradewind Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Early Childhood Teacher

*A chance to step away from the classroom*


The Brotherhood of St Laurence drives changes that promote a compassionate and fair society where everyone has a sense of belonging. The National Disability Insurance Scheme has engaged Early Childhood Early Intervention (ECEI) partners around Australia to deliver the ECEI approach.


The Brotherhood of St Laurence is the ECEI partner for the North East Melbourne, Hume Moreland, Bayside Peninsula, Brimbank Melton and Western Melbourne areas.


The ECEI approach supports children aged 0-6 years who have a developmental delay or disability and their families/carers. Supporting families to help children develop the skills they need to take part in daily activities and achieve the best possible outcomes throughout their life is a fundamental part of the ECEI approach.


The Brotherhood are seeking passionate and engaging individuals form the following disciplines:

  • Early Childhood Education - VIT Registered
  • Occupational Therapy - AHPRA
  • Physiotherapy - AHPRA
  • Psychology - AHPRA
  • Social Work
  • Speech Pathology

Equipped with strong early childhood developmental knowledge and excellent clinical observation skills, you are known for your ability to quickly and genuinely establish and build relationships. You are committed to capacity building within the family environment as well as within the community, and understand the positive impact that community inclusion and participation has on people’s lives.


This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a collaborative and transdisciplinary team with a strong focus on continuous improvement and professional development.


Apply now to join a values driven organisation and improve the lives of young children and their families!

People with a lived experience of disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and people from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

884138727:
[

Occupational Health Nurse

Company Name The GO2 People Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

One of our key clients is seeking some energetic and dynamic Nurses to join their team. We would love to see your application especially if you have some Occupational Health experience.

\xa0

The primary function of the role will be to work with their key clients to deliver pre-employment medical assessments, health surveillance programs, functional capacity evaluations, vaccinations and associated health promotion.

\xa0

We have multiple casual and permanent opportunities in various locations around Melbourne working anything from 20 - 40 hours per week, with potential to go full time if desired.

\xa0

You will be required to:

  • Provide high quality medical assessment primarily for pre-employment medical assessments, including hearing (audiometry exams), spirometry (lung function assessment), vision screening, musculoskeletal examinations, functional capacity evaluations, drug and alcohol screenings and other relevant requirements.
  • Provide onsite (client premises) services if and as requested e.g. medical assessments, vaccinations such as flu and hepatitis, drug screening programs.
  • General health and wellness promotion, cessation of smoking, exercise and diet modification.
  • Referrals where appropriate to allied health services / specialists for review e.g. GP, optometrist review, diabetic nurse educator etc.
  • Operate effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team to ensure an environment that encourages teamwork, personal and professional development, customer service and excellence in performance.
  • Manage allocated administrative and service tasks including ensuring timeframes and schedules are adhered too, management and safe use of medical equipment, and if required, the ordering or reordering of supplies and equipment.
  • Ensure at all times the highest level of customer service via optimal communication, presentation and professional expertise.

\xa0

Preferred Qualifications, Education and/or Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Nursing.
  • Current Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA) registration.
  • Current Australian drivers licence.
  • Accreditations - Drug and Alcohol and Vaccinations.
  • Previous experience as a Registered Nurse, either in a generalist setting or specializing in Occupational Health.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including demonstrated experience interacting with a wide range of people.
  • Ability to deliver services in a manner consistent with the requirements of the client and/or the service agreement between Jobfit and the client.
  • Basic/Intermediate computer skills.

\xa0

If this opportunity is for you, please apply directly to this ad with your LinkedIn profile.
